channel.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
channel.description:
Hello guys! As you may know, there are around 60 days left for Mass Effect 3 to come out, so I'm getting ready for it :slight_smile: And, well, I wanna try and make a male Shepard too, so I can have two careers to import into ME3. Thing is, I can never make a good looking MaleShep, so I was wondering if there is anybody out here who could help :slight_smile:
I really would like my Shep to look like this guy (NPC from Kasumi's loyalty mission, who appears at the beginning and then just stands by the door):
![](upload://6I6PuuEmauXO02up6hgyYXrei26.jpeg)
![](upload://6I6PuuEmauXO02up6hgyYXrei26.jpeg)
![](upload://6I6PuuEmauXO02up6hgyYXrei26.jpeg)
![](upload://6I6PuuEmauXO02up6hgyYXrei26.jpeg)
![](upload://6I6PuuEmauXO02up6hgyYXrei26.jpeg)
Any help would be greatly appreciated! :slight_smile:

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
ME1 version of my most recent male and fem sheps. Will post ME2 in a bit. All from Xbox 360 versions. Because my computer sucked for a long time.


Seeing my femshep again, I realize it’s the only one I managed to not look like all the others I’ve made.

Here’s ME2 male and fem sheps.


Read full topic

Unfortunately, he is on the 360, so I can’t just screencap him =(

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
That does look like you indeed

I heard that the demo is coming out on the 14th of February, I wonder if it’s just the coop, you’ll get to customize characters… It would be fun to play as you and be the cool ginger of the group, haha!

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

I’ll put up a pic of my ginger Shep when I get home. :3

Jesus, it took me long enough… here’s ginger shep.

I was originally trying to make him look like me, but I couldn’t quite get it right. The complexion is right, the eyes are mostly right, and the hair is exactly right, but I couldn’t really get the rest of it as exact as I would have liked, so I just called it good. I like it. Could not for the life of me get a flattering screenshot of him, though.

Read full topic

item.description:
I don’t think I’ve ever seen a male Shepard I liked better than the default.

item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: Rosie
item.description:
Now, get me in front of Oblivion or Fallout 3, and I’ll be there for a while

I did spend a good bit of time in the Oblivion one despite the general “marshmallow-esque” plague that most oblivion faces got, it was still a pretty good system

Fallout3 on the other hand… didn’t like it at all

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Ten plus.

I often spend a lot of time when I make a maleshep, but when I make a femshep I don’t spend as much, because what I come up with, that looks good to me, always looks the same anyway. The only differences are, usually, hair style and eye color, the rest always end up the same or close enough that I don’t worry too much about them.

Now, get me in front of Oblivion or Fallout 3, and I’ll be there for a while

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Ten minutes? I always spend 30-60 minutes making my character. In any game with character creation.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Rosie:

yeah all the faces I try making myself… they look great in the creation bit, but then in game they turn out ugly.

No joke, my first character in the first game, I didn’t recognize him once he arrived on the Normandy’s bridge. I was all “who is this clown?” It’s a sad day when lighting makes that big of a difference with a character you spent 10+ minutes tweaking.

Read full topic

item.description:
Yeah seriously, Mark Vanderloo Shepard is by far my favorite.

item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: Rosie
item.description:
yeah all the faces I try making myself… they look great in the creation bit, but then in game they turn out ugly. Regardless i have yet to find a male morph that i’ve liked more than the default so that’s what i play as. I did find a nice femshep morph that i tweeked a little more that turned out very nice. Thats the one ive been using all through ME1 and 2. Sadly you cant make it in ME2 and all attempts ive gone through just turn out wrong…

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.description:
Kairouseki:

What is that sort of digital chainmail type armor you have? It looks really cool.

It’s the Sentinel’s Tech Armor, I have it too. Sentinels FTW!

item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

I hate how, no matter what I do, my femsheps always end up eerily similar. And even weirder, my femshep look is similar to Jokerine’s femshep.

Hah, yeah, I’ve noticed that too - so many FemSheps are similar to mine, starting with the hair, and then a sorta “pointy” face, and well, it builds from there… I took some pics of my Shep today, mostly sportin’ dat Sentry Interface.

Hopefully this will make our Sheps look different

Now I just gotta wait for Siggs to see what can be done about my MaleShep… If anybody else wants to help, I’ll be glad!

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I hate how, no matter what I do, my femsheps always end up eerily similar. And even weirder, my femshep look is similar to Jokerine’s femshep.

I have made a decent maleshep, IMO, I’ll see if I can take pics of him. Then I have the white (very pale) version of Siggs’ maleshep.

item.description:
I once managed to make a black manshep that was actually very fucking hot. No homo.

What killed it was seeing that guy talk with a white man’s voice.

item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Okay, here’s my save .

Yay, thanks! I’ll dissect this and see what the results are

Maxey:

Hopefully ME3 has a much improved face editor that allows me to make a Shep that is at least borderline handsome.

Yeah, that’s my main gripe with playing a male Shep (not to mention the voice) - the fact that, no matter what I do, I just can’t make one that looks nice enough. A shame

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!

item.title: Calling all talented ME2 face creators!
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Maxey:

Hopefully ME3 has a much improved face editor that allows me to make a Shep that is at least borderline handsome.

That’d be good… I wonder if they’ll allow editing imported characters faces? (would make less sense in-game than the way Mass Effect 2 handled it, but would hopefully help to fix some of the weirdness of my characters face… it looked okay in ME1 but looks a bit odd in ME2, maybe due to the contrast with the more detailed NPCs)

Read full topic

Maxey:

Hopefully ME3 has a much improved face editor that allows me to make a Shep that is at least borderline handsome.

Well it better be but don’t hold your breath.

And my paragon shep

item.description:
Yeah, I guess mine is

To be honest, I only went with the makeup because otherwise her eyes looked weird (and it does feel like it’s too much), but I’m trying to keep her hair under control! And I dunno, I mean, I agree with the Ashley bit, but Miranda isn’t exactly part of the army, is she?
